articles.title: Turning Back the Cosmic Clock: How NASA's Roman Space Telescope Will Rewind the Universe - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A new simulation shows how NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will turn back the cosmic clock, unveiling the evolving universe in ways that have never been possible before when it launches by May 2027. With its ability to rapidly image enormous swaths o…
articles.content:
ByAshley Balzer, NASAs Goddard Space Flight CenterMarch 4, 2023
In this side view of the simulated universe, each dot represents a galaxy whose size and brightness corresponds to its mass. Slices fr… [+10454 chars]

articles.author: Daniela Hernandez
articles.title: Take a Plunge Under Antarctica’s Ice, With Robots - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Researchers sent robots deep into the frozen continent and got unprecedented close-up views beneath Antarctica’s ice. Among the goals: add more nuanced data to climate models.
articles.content: Marine ice (top left) has a greenish tint to it. By comparison, glacial ice (bottom left), which forms on land, is white. The transition from white to green ice is the supercooling horizon, says Dr. … [+141 chars]
